ratePolicies.description: A popular brute force attack that consists of sending a large number of requests for base page, HTML page or XHR requests (usually non-cacheable). This could destabilize the origin.
ratePolicies.name: Page View Requests

ratePolicies.description: An excessive error rate from the origin could indicate malicious activity by a bot scanning the site or a publishing error. In both cases, this would increase the origin traffic and could potentially destabilize it.
ratePolicies.name: Origin Error

ratePolicies.description: Mitigating HTTP flood attacks using POST requests
ratePolicies.name: POST Page Requests

customRules.metadata:
<match:metadata-stage value="client-request-body">
    <match:regex flags="s" impl="re2" regex="((?i)(?:\x5c|(?:%(?:c(?:0%(?:[2aq]f|5c|9v)|1%(?:[19p]c|8s|af))|2(?:5(?:c(?:0%25af|1%259c)|2f|5c)|%46|f)|(?:(?:f(?:8%8)?0%8|e)0%80%a|bg%q)f|%3(?:2(?:%(?:%6|4)6|F)|5%%63)|u(?:221[56]|002f|EFC8|F025)|1u|5c)|0x(?:2f|5c)|\/))(?:%(?:(?:f(?:(?:c%80|8)%8)?0%8|e)0%80%ae|2(?:(?:5(?:c0%25a|2))?e|%45)|u(?:(?:002|ff0)e|2024)|%32(?:%(?:%6|4)5|E)|c0(?:%[256aef]e|\.))|\.(?:%0[01]|\?)?|\?\.?|0x2e){1,2};*?(?:\x5c|(?:%(?:c(?:0%(?:[2aq]f|5c|9v)|1%(?:[19p]c|8s|af))|2(?:5(?:c(?:0%25af|1%259c)|2f|5c)|%46|f)|(?:(?:f(?:8%8)?0%8|e)0%80%a|bg%q)f|%3(?:2(?:%(?:%6|4)6|F)|5%%63)|u(?:221[56]|002f|EFC8|F025)|1u|5c)|0x(?:2f|5c)|\/)))" select="ARGS|ARGS_NAMES|REQUEST_COOKIES|REQUEST_COOKIES_NAMES|REQUEST_HEADERS|!REQUEST_HEADERS:Cookie|FILES|FILES_NAMES|JSON_PAIRS:'/*'|JSON_NAMES|XML_PAIRS:'/*'" strict-err-check-re2="on" variable-list="LOGDATA">
        <security:firewall.action>
            <msg>Custom Rule for 950103 detected(Minus REQUEST_FILENAME)</msg>
            <tag>AKAMAI/CUSTOM/60039230</tag>
            <id>60039230</id>
            <action>%(WAF_CUSTOM_R60039230_ACTION)</action>
            <data>%(LOGDATA)</data>
        </security:firewall.action>
    </match:regex>
</match:metadata-stage>
customRules.name: Mimic rule of 950103 (minus REQUEST_FILENAME)
